intro: Bothriocline huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Bothriocline huillensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native ecosystem.
